objectives: Tell multi-step journeys using anchored landmarks and classifier paths
Portray at least two obstacles and fixes (detours, delays) with clear NMMs
Blend narration and dialogue via role-shift with neutral returns and time-first sequencing

vocab.def: Vehicle / person / surface for routes, blocks, and layouts.
CL:B wall, construction, crowd; use tense NMM.
Path shifts around obstacle; show new route clearly.
Landing point and completion marker at the end of a segment.
Short lines for driver/walker/guide; return to neutral to narrate.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Landmarks Grid (4 Points)
sections.body: Anchor **HOME (center)**, **SCHOOL (left)**, **STORE (right-up)**, **HOSPITAL (right-down)**. Point to lock them; reuse exactly.

sections.heading: Technique: Path Readability
sections.body: Use **Place â†’ Orient â†’ Move** rhythm for each leg. Keep paths small and distinct; stop points crisp. For perspective changes, insert a **VV CUT** (tiny pause + snap) before continuing.

callouts.title: One Camera
callouts.body: Stay top-down for routes; switch to street view only after a clear cut for RS dialogue.

microCheck.q: Best way to change perspective mid-story:

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Three-Leg Route

sections.body: Plan **3 legs** with **2 obstacles** and **2 fixes**. Must include: **1 CL:3** route, **1 CL:1** action (walk), **1 RS** help line, **2 FINISH** markers (end of legs A & C).

microCheck.q: Minimum technique set for this drill:

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **18â€“25s**: multi-leg navigation story with **time-first framing**, **2 obstacles** (block/traffic), **2 fixes** (detour/ask), **1 RS** line, and **ARRIVE FINISH**. Caption the obstacles and fixes you used.
sections.teacherNote: If anchors drift, re-point once before your next RS line.
